ticketsBlock.title: Tickets
ticketsBlock.ticketsDetails: Tickets grant access to all conference sections, and include nibbles. Accommodation is NOT included in the ticket price and is your responsibility. Availability dates and ticket types are preliminary, and may be subject to change.

team.description: The FOSS4G SotM Oceania 2019 organising committee is made up of geospatial enthusiasts from scientific, business, humanitarian, and government sectors.

blocks.title: Travel Grant Program
blocks.description:
We're pleased to announce our Travel Grant Program for 2019! Applications are open until 30 June. If you (or someone you know) live in Oceania and require financial assistance to attend the conference, please check out our Travel Grant Program page for more details.

Also, if you or your organisation wish to contribute to this important initiative, please get in touch at tgp@foss4g-oceania.org. The program is built on financial support from OSGeo and conference sponsors and attendees, and 100% of your contribution will go directly to assisting people from around our region to attend.

blocks.title: Tiakiwai Conference Centre
blocks.description: Our conference venue is an event destination cloaked in history, knowledge, and cultural significance. Featuring contemporary design, cutting-edge technology and multipurpose spaces, it's a great place to host our next edition of FOSS4G SotM Oceania.

callToAction.label: The National Library of New Zealand

blocks.title: Rutherford House
blocks.description: Rutherford House is part of Victoria University of Wellington's Pipitea Campus. Our workshop and community day rooms are modern teaching spaces in an annexe built in 2017, with a large mezzanine for breaks and networking.
